    source ‘rubygems.org’

    gem ‘rails’, ‘3.2.8’

    # Bundle edge Rails instead: # gem ‘rails’, :git => ‘git://github.com/rails/rails.git’

    gem ‘pg’

    # Gems used only for assets and not required # in production environments by default. group :assets do

    gem 'sass-rails',   '~> 3.2.3'
gem 'coffee-rails', '~> 3.2.1'

# See https://github.com/sstephenson/execjs#readme for more supported runtimes
# gem 'therubyracer', :platforms => :ruby

gem 'uglifier', '>= 1.0.3'

    end

    gem ‘jquery-rails’

    # This is an ActiveRecord connection adapter for PostGIS. It is based on the stock PostgreSQL adapter, but provides built-in support for the spatial extensions provided by PostGIS. It uses the RGeo library to represent spatial data in Ruby. gem “activerecord-postgis-adapter”, “~> 0.4.3”

    # RGeo is a geospatial data library for Ruby # homepage: dazuma.github.com/rgeo/ # source: github.com/dazuma/rgeo # doc: dazuma.github.com/rgeo/rdoc/ gem “rgeo”, “~> 0.3.19”

    # ffi-geos is an implementation of the GEOS Ruby bindings in Ruby via FFI. # github.com/dark-panda/ffi-geos gem ‘ffi-geos’

    # RGeo::GeoJSON is an optional RGeo module providing GeoJSON encoding and decoding services. This module can be used to communicate with location-based web services that understand the GeoJSON forma # homepage: dazuma.github.com/rgeo-geojson/ # doc: dazuma.github.com/rgeo-geojson/rdoc/ # source: github.com/dazuma/rgeo-geojson # www.geojson.org/ gem “rgeo-geojson”, “~> 0.2.3”

    # RGeo::Shapefile is an optional module for RGeo for reading geospatial data from ESRI shapefiles. # homepage: dazuma.github.com/rgeo-shapefile/ # doc: dazuma.github.com/rgeo-shapefile/rdoc/ # source: github.com/dazuma/rgeo-shapefile gem ‘rgeo-shapefile’, “~> 0.2.3”

    # This gem provides the leaflet.js map display library for your Rails 3 application. # rubygems.org/gems/leaflet-rails gem “leaflet-rails”, “~> 0.4.5”

    # rubyzip is a ruby library for reading and writing zip files # github.com/aussiegeek/rubyzip gem ‘rubyzip’, “~> 0.9.9”

    group :development, :test do

    gem "quiet_assets", ">= 1.0.1"
gem "pry-rails"
# Combine 'pry' with 'debugger'. Adds 'step', 'next', and 'continue' commands to control execution.
# use "binding.pry" as "debugger"
gem "pry-debugger"

    end
